41998667D15640F5BFE6E9C7A21F78F0.description: Write routinely in a genre over extended time frames (planning, drafting, editing, revising, publishing) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes and audiences.

C7DC231013C4473E90131BBEB1562E97.description: Write routinely over shorter time frames (e.g., journal entry, letter, graphic organizer) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes and audiences.

DCA7636CCA0F42D5B39EDEFE7518B6BE.description: Draw evidence from informational text to support an analysis, reflection or research.

0DFA93BB2AF64B46B31F8F2623C76AC9.description: Draw evidence from literary text to support an analysis or reflection.

9171512D2C8040CB8E54FBA4B4999665.description: Provide a list of sources that contributed to the content within a writing piece.

7E71976AF27046FDB19CA91323DC0BFB.description: Gather information that relates to an informational topic or subject (e.g., highlight, quote or paraphrase from source) relevant to the topic from print and/or digital sources.

EEAC39F2AEE4444A82D11B3505BBE3C3.description: Gather relevant information that relates to a topic or idea within a story (e.g., highlight in text, quote or paraphrase from text) from print and/or digital sources.

56C86FFA3C4240619D43D1C0D017A0E1.description: Gather relevant information that relates to a persuasive topic (e.g., highlight in text, quote or paraphrase from text or discussion) from print and/or digital sources.

07029DF8C31F4E538FA3355E698E83CA.description: Follow steps to complete a short research project (e.g., determine topic, locate information on a topic, organize information related to the topic, draft a permanent product).

1C3F6EDF645648289FEEBACEA4EC0BD7.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

89E4C4736DD24E89B9E40CCF64A6C729.description: Use technology to produce and publish writing (e.g., use the Internet to gather information, use word processing to generate and collaborate on writing).

2330DECD130449FB9FA0BFD1C671DA7D.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing by planning, revising, editing, rewriting or trying a new approach.

D5138CDB7CD143DEBABC789B741EA438.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising and editing.

57F1086983CD4C8D9917539D30402B80.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing (e.g., determine the topic, gather information, develop the topic, provide a meaningful conclusion).

4AA74E8B6B4A4A17BEDD91B8352590EA.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for informative writing (e.g., choose a topic, introduce story elements, develop storyline, conclude story).

D404ED971BFE4725941CCA4996A2E7EC.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for narrative writing (e.g., define purpose, state your claim, gather evidence, create your argument, provide a meaningful conclusion).

577487F1FBA84043A4AB43B23EA36E2B.description: Produce a clear, coherent, permanent product (e.g., select/generate responses to form paragraphs or essay) that is appropriate to the specific task, purpose and audience.

CB4B6E381ECF4BB681616195BC1AFFF4.description: Produce a clear, coherent, permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task, purpose (e.g., to entertain) and audience.

2B60EF46976B48D38867B57E43CC4D30.description: Produce a clear, coherent, permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task (e.g., topic), purpose (e.g., to inform) and audience (e.g., reader).

B08005651A6E42E4BEFBC27DB97AE51D.description: Provide a conclusion (concluding sentence, paragraph or extended ending) that follows from the narrated events.

D88C512EC83847409ED818D5068DE555.description: Write a narrative that includes smaller segments of conflict and resolution in the text that contribute to the plot.

E058219A89694347A0582B1E4D72772C.description: Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely.

26158C9309A94C7AA22AF6018C8806FA.description: Use transitional words, phrases and clauses to manage the sequence of events.

9C12067F19F5435ABB49109DA1C00589.description: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, description and pacing, to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to situations.

3ECF0442E7A54C3B91997CA1C5E6378A.description: Organize ideas and events so that they unfold naturally.

86F4E8268CDE43679BCFC6DA9EA23F70.description: Orient the reader by establishing a situation and introducing a narrator and/or characters.

095ED6A006CD49C6A906B239E7E1626C.description: Provide a concluding statement or section to summarize the information presented.

F844E5D6823742B7AC8D1BDAAEE07D4A.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

D56F70FD350D44EEA02760FF66D2D99D.description: Use transitional words, phrases and clauses that connect ideas and create cohesion within writing.

3FD1086C92C541DEA63C091F49F0E7F7.description: Include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables) and multimedia appropriate to convey information about the topic.

7604C744B778467C95EA7FC13FBDAEE0.description: Support the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations or other information and examples.

077E7B70B40B47ABBFF3235B1331CC0C.description: Organize ideas, concepts and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast and cause/effect.

677BC967153A4F95858338DE716BDEFC.description: Write an introduction that includes context/background information and establishes a central idea or focus about a topic.

FE2FBAD7E8A74DEFB8C21B2167BCF185.description: Provide a clear concluding statement or section related to the opinion stated.

B82CFF04315C40989F4ABE7080436133.description: Link opinions and reasons using words, phrases and clauses.

BCA1D5D48721425993E4171FDA48AD9E.description: Provide relevant facts to support stated opinion or reasons within persuasive writing.

962FC93329CD46EC93F3841634403B3D.description: Create an organizational structure in which ideas are logically grouped to support the writers opinion.

4714E6E0DB2745ACAF468D98776254EF.description: Provide an introduction that states own opinion within persuasive text.

C21A893A71C44D83AA7669EB3E69D5C2.description: Speak using formal English discourse (academic language) during collaborative conversations or class discussions.

DB6189C002EA4BE8ADD36F5F0429D8FD.description: Recognize situations when the use of formal English is necessary (e.g., making a presentation vs. talking with friends).

CE38ADC7EB834B82B69409C135161F09.description: Use captioned pictures, labeled diagrams, tables or other visual displays in presentations when appropriate to support the topic or theme.

823609BADBBD4066BDCEFD8B8ABD3DD3.description: Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, sound) in presentation when appropriate to enhance the development of topic.

60D6CA3596EE4DF59BCCD47443688B08.description: Elaborate on each fact or opinion given in support of a claim with relevant details.

07147C3B129C4F92AFF262E58ED477C1.description: Speak clearly and at an understandable pace.

C7514ABC22E04B24ADA19FC8479C1701.description: Orally present a topic, story or claim with a logical sequence of ideas, appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details.

12D78399EEB64A1BB6E7A4DD8FB46D0A.description: Explain how at least one perspective in a discussion is supported by reasons and evidence.

8D0C7138DA86477BA4D59F4CB4AC03AE.description: Identify reasons and evidence that a speaker provides to support points or claims.

3CA909D922CC4D1E891AC0188C94A200.description: Identify a speakers points or claims.

BAEF3EBD22FE49FDB52B67D765408EDD.description: Summarize the points a speaker makes.

1C72BA7331644211B16F679861B3A162.description: Summarize the text or a portion of the text read, read aloud or presented in diverse media.

6EC8D6EB96E64E6A917703295724374A.description: Determine the narrative point of view of a text read, read aloud or viewed.

46199854EDEF48438F039FB446BE9CFD.description: Elaborate and build on others' ideas using textual evidence to support their own ideas.

C4114C68F3774918A1E3B1CB5BAE43A1.description: Review and respond to the key ideas expressed within a collaborative discussion.

E0EF29FF77E449A3A7A98E50D969F0E5.description: Follow discussion rules and protocols using academic language.

3EC1A66476A0437F80B36326A06E2578.description: Make appropriate comments that contribute to a collaborative discussion.

F1FB574C99C84DC2BD0600A86B463871.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition.

14CA454EE55F464DB0F1053B27D90775.description: Use morphemes (e.g., roots and affixes) to decode unfamiliar multisyllabic words in and out of context.

9574DD809E89401BA13A264396F42629.description: Use syllabication patterns to decode words.

FB3D8D9C2D18494FB5DA888BFE565D1A.description: Use a variety of strategies to derive meaning from a variety of texts.

BA22A3002246463DA8FE2B43AF850489.description: Read or listen to a variety of texts or adapted texts including graphic novels, poetry, fiction and nonfiction novels.

EC2AFCD83D33401E9C2051932CDEEFC6.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

AB4080888DA84BFF8FA46F9B8D2F4277.description: Describe how the theme of stories in the same genre approach.

B6034A8D5451425E85146609F5F207EE.description: Contrast the differences of stories in the same genre.

05FC566E738F4A31BD86C1A82B8E9FDE.description: Compare the similarities of stories in the same genre (e.g., mysteries and adventure stories) on their approaches to similar themes and topics.

B8D0FEE86AB2444C867E813345BE42F2.description: Describe how visual or multimedia elements contribute to the tone or mood of a text (e.g., graphic novel, multimedia presentation of fiction, folktale, myth, poem).

DEF6A433424F4216809AF79BC505F305.description: Describe how visual and multimedia elements contribute to the meaning of a text (e.g., graphic novel, multimedia presentation of fiction, folktale, myth, poem).

2ABE526867244097B04FA4290B25C6A1.description: Interpret the meaning of metaphors and similes to help determine the mood within a text.

68EDEA89587649E0B70EADF3D877FE6A.description: Interpret the meaning of metaphors and similes to help explain the setting within a text.

F6F1CAFC6F8145D0A5B665BD3A4E062A.description: Explain how the description of characters, setting or events might change if the person telling the story changed.

B53EFC5CC9444D22AD9EA8399A3F85FA.description: Describe how the speaker's point of view influences the events in the text.

CD0C4E9E091E4D93AEC2DF58BCA58F3F.description: Describe a narrators or speakers point of view.

9A910C936E85431095C40F8B280863DC.description: Explain how a stanzas fit together to provide the structure of a poem.

03F1F764CFBF4C549D7A8FEDD9090616.description: Explain how a series of chapters fits together to provide the overall structure of a particular text.

E47B48B4FCA84CB2A700758A96AAAD20.description: Use signal words (e.g., meanwhile, unlike, next) to identify common types of text structure (e.g., sequence, compare/contrast, cause/effect, description) within a text.

F3CD5AD2F9F74B1F8CD01843BB0EDEBC.description: Determine the meaning of figurative language as it is used in the text.

247930E79ACC45A4B2BE759FD0F9D2F8.description: Identify figurative language (metaphors/similes) within a text.

32B8B06C54E34E6CB7C6B43A2CDDF683.description: Contrast the difference of two or more characters, settings or events in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., how characters interact).

F4356D1557CC495D937D1C7330780B58.description: Compare similarities in the characters, settings and events within a story and provide specific details in the text to support the comparison.

AC3E951811A7482DA683E96643B5A504.description: Explain how the speaker in a poem reflects on the topic.

A7E5936E83CE4C129FA62A23F133B567.description: Explain how characters in a story or drama respond to challenges.

2132E2D5932C4C8C9970E6506A4970B6.description: Determine the theme of a story, drama or poem from details in the text.

717065EF753745ACB43D6B14AA7DA162.description: Summarize a text from beginning to end in a few sentences.

D20C8F6101D74CB4BC0031BE3E30A27B.description: Summarize a portion of text, such as a paragraph or a chapter.

BAA1801AC2894F32922492FB18A89077.description: Refer to specific text evidence to support inferences.

544BCDE1C1B341D8A597653BF36FE31A.description: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly.

B298EA1FFB204708BC45BD11693D3079.description: Use a variety of strategies (e.g., use context, affixes and roots) to derive meaning from a variety of print/non-print texts.

4C8FC54EFE3243ED805F23214BD8AADA.description: Read or listen to a variety of texts including history/social studies, science and technical nonfiction texts.

ECE61EDB41724A158055AD83C74F1BA7.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

CE130ADFFA834ED6BFD532C051C4BBB9.description: Integrate information on a topic from multiple sources to answer a question or support a focus or opinion in writing or presentation.

CD1E53F6EF58446D8F8D89E91585225B.description: Identify key details from multiple sources on the same topic (e.g., what are the important things that you learned?).

7E7166A3D6C44D41847161EFADF34754.description: Identify evidence the author uses to support stated thesis/claim/opinion.

F453471BFE2C4C41BC977067E329E34B.description: Identify reasons and evidence that support an authors point(s) in a text.

C0EA2331154C45CFB86C30DD325F9941.description: Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text.

2366E9BA6F714959815E6F1411D82C6A.description: Refer to multiple print or digital sources as support for inferences (e.g., how did you know?).

B1C527580DE74A988CD21CE44F526A7E.description: Refer to multiple print or digital sources to locate the answer to a question or solve a problem.

454480460EFC4087B681B7B42B3CC515.description: Locate information from multiple print or digital sources on the same topic.

A4FA8C4F003A46388F46584E06593B8C.description: Note similarities and differences in the point of view of multiple accounts of the same event or topic.

0B8BABEFD4F7441C837D890B7891095B.description: Analyze multiple accounts of the same event or topic.

4BDF9C3C59874A28BDD472364BE115CD.description: Compare and contrast the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts or information in two or more texts.

EAF38C86F209454890A6DD2FE031F959.description: Identify the structure of both texts (chronological order, compare/contrast, cause/effect, problem/solution).

5F3AAC0A9D864DD39861CB8D66777FF2.description: Use signal word to identify common types of text structure.

29DB6F21A30847C082204055E77CA2B5.description: Use signal words as a means of locating information (e.g., knowing that because or as a result of may help link a cause to a result).

538FF2D3F9A547E9877ADE6F30FAFFA6.description: Determine the meaning of domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 5 topic or subject area.

E5774ED9CC0441E8B692C98D048BB3CD.description: Determine the meaning of general academic words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 5 topic or subject area.

69498A04958045CA8368CF9B53EA1B38.description: Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more individuals, events, ideas or concepts in a historical, scientific or technical text based on specific information in the text.

A633E28F852F4DD98A388E2BF434EBC9.description: Identify the relationship between two or more events of concepts in a historical, scientific or technical text.

0FA5313F88AA43D285603A67AE4891CC.description: Identify the relationship between two or more individuals in a historical, scientific or technical text.

D23E9B91F05F4AD28418CE1BC2751A1E.description: Summarize the text read, read aloud or presented in diverse media.

EBA09B27FA5A407EBBCE3547402D6F1A.description: Identify key details that support the main idea.

5D7A284C221D452682F2D97B767AC10A.description: Determine the main ideas of a text.

5C9EE504BFD64BE49113782D30BCB0D0.description: Quote accurately from a text to support inferences.

F5C7E911A18849919F95656A3BA0D3BF.description: Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly.

5D2CD777635C49E4B9602B969C7994F1.description: Use grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases accurately within informational writing.

C387CE8FDB2642A29E33453C762626C8.description: Use general academic and domain-specific words and phrases accurately.

FEECB2B23DDE41D7B4C41D62C13EEFBE.description: Use figurative language in context, including similes and metaphors.

84D00D6FC8F34D32AF2463F8DC5CC1D3.description: Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonyms, antonyms, homographs) in writing to promote understanding of each of the words.

610A8A1B2ACC429780D3A94BCDB12F6E.description: Identify the meaning of common idioms or proverbs.

0012B9AED24C48EFAEF34B14FECDE1A3.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative language, such as metaphors and similes.

1297DA57D80C4058A75CB0788242E4F2.description: Find the precise meaning of a word.

D5205B68D2BE418D85B7DE62E2FCB564.description: Find the pronunciation of a word.

97193570D5AB499FB669C051CA175D31.description: Use common grade-appropriate roots and affixes as clues to the meaning of a word.

28621D567ABE449FB02404D8AAF08E88.description: Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence, paragraph or text; a words position in a sentence) to determine the meaning of unknown or multiple-meaning words.

3E7DB5C7186D4770B7321BF7F65F8C73.description: Expand, combine and reduce sentences for meaning, reader interest and style for writing or speaking.

9E4D0585265D4829BFF2AD2B804F2FB5.description: Spell words correctly in writing, consulting references as needed.

1B2F95CA90144DFBA4394703FE7EED0A.description: Use punctuation to separate items in a series.

59E4DC93A3AF4041B5183583AFA1BEDB.description: Identify and use conjunctions, prepositions and interjections in writing.

563D7CAEFDB2410A9A0EE88E229B42C8.description: Use appropriate verb tense to convey times, sequence, state and condition.

990920A334D7494FA3BDB38BC03F3FBB.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb tense.
